Wipplsystems¶

class pleiades.wipplsystems.Dipole(**kwargs)[source]¶

Internal dipole Magnet comprised of 2 cylindrical SmCo magnets.

magnets¶

list – list of Magnet objects comprising this instance

patches¶

list of matplotlib.patches.Polygon instances – patches representing the vessel magnets

class pleiades.wipplsystems.PCX_HH(t_current, b_current, fc='0.35')[source]¶

PCX Helmholtz coil set

t_current¶

double – current through top HH coil

b_current¶

double – current through bottom HH coil

fc¶

str – facecolor for patch

top_coil¶

CurrentArray – CurrentArray object for top coil

bot_coil¶

CurrentArray – CurrentArray object for bottom coil

current_objs¶

list – list of Current objects comprising this instance

patches¶

list of matplotlib.patches.Polygon instances – patches representing the PCX HH coils

class pleiades.wipplsystems.PCX_magCage(current_mags=None)[source]¶

Represent an array of dipole magnets that comprise the PCX magnet cage.

magnets¶

list – list of Magnet objects comprising this instance

patches¶

list of matplotlib.patches.Polygon instances – patches representing the cage magnets

get_current_tuples(frame='rhoz', units='m')[source]¶

Return computationally relevant info: list of (rho, z, current) tuples for instance.

set_strength(current_mags)[source]¶

Set strength of each magnet with 1D array current_mags

class pleiades.wipplsystems.TREXcoil(**kwargs)[source]¶
pleiades.wipplsystems.build_pcx(vessel=True, HH=(False, 0, 0))[source]¶

“Return field objects and patches representing PCX (modified copy of build_wipal).

Kwargs:

vessel (bool): boolean to include vessel magnets or not, default True HH (tuple): tuple of (bool,float,float) representing whether or not to include

helmholtz coil set and, if so, how much current goes into the upper and lower coil, respectively default (False,0,0)
